= make matrix =
ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/974931/multiply-operator-applied-to-listdata-structure

{{{class="brush: python"
def make_matrix(rows, columns):
"""
  >>> make_matrix(4, 2)
  [[0, 0], [0, 0], [0, 0], [0, 0]]
  >>> m = make_matrix(4, 2)
  >>> m[1][1] = 7
  >>> m
  [[0, 0], [0, 7], [0, 0], [0, 0]]
"""
matrix = []
for row in range(rows):
    matrix += [[0] * columns]
return matrix
}}}

= formated printing =
{{{class="brush: python"
items = ['a', 'abcd', 'abcdefg', 'abcdefghijklmn']
for i in items:
    print "Name: %s Price: %s" % (i, i)

for i in items:
    print "Name: %-20s Price: %10.10s" % (i, i)
}}}

= uniquify a list =
== elements hashable ==
{{{
alist = list(set(alist))
}}}
== elements unhashable ==
{{{
alist = [k for k,v in itertools.groupby(sorted(alist))]
}}}
